reviews.review_msg: Dr. Barenscott was one of the best profs I've ever had. Her lectures are super engaging and loves when students give her artwork that they've made. Such an amazing woman. She may seem tough and strict at first but as long as you do your journals and take good notes, you'll do well.
She actually knows how to teach art in a way that makes you want to know more. We took her for granted first term and now we have Denise and all collectively shout #bringDorthyback

She doesn't care about her students, doesn't like emails, her offices hours are ONLY on Thursdays 5:20 to 6:20pm, and speaks extremely fast. Her exams were really hard and she marks as if she doesn't want you to succeed. I still love Modern Art History, but she made me not like it during these classes because of her teaching.
Speaks too fast, a bad attitude. Assumes all students will finish a 22 page reading in 30 minutes and give a short amount of time for reflective journals.

The information-heavy lectures were difficult to get through, but she was well aware of it and stayed engaging and compassionate. In-class participation was a bit intimidating but she is respectful; enjoyable to talk to during breaks/office hours. School required a textbook for the class but it wasn't necessary. Try not to miss a class or project.

Dr. Barenscott is passionate about her lectures. She will make the class so enjoyable that you will dissolve into the materials even if you don't have any interest in learning about art history. The whole course is about discussing paintings, how interesting it is! The best part is that we get to work on our journals, providing our creativity.

Dr. Barenscott is the best prof I have ever had. She is incredibly passionate and engaging and clearly loves her students. Her lectures are fast-paced and content-heavy, but she makes sure to answer questions and give time for breaks. She is always making it known that she has plenty of availability during her office hours. She's a queen.

Dr.b is a real Gem. She knows what she is doing and takes her course seriously. You have to work for your grade, she is a fair grader so if you work hard don't worry about the result. Skip a class? you won't pass. Although she works based on textbooks, I didn't use one. Therefore, pay extra extra attention to lectures and you will pass.
